sentences.en: Elizabeth was crowned in Westminster Abbey on 2 June 1953.
sentences.cn: 伊丽莎白于1953年6月2日在威斯敏斯特大教堂加冕。

sentences.en: Exports in June rose 1.5% to a record $30.91 billion.
sentences.cn: 6月份的出口额上升了1.5%，创下309.1亿美元的历史最高纪录。

sentences.en: He spent two and a half weeks with us in June 1986.
sentences.cn: 1986年6月他和我们一起呆了两周半。

sentences.en: He was knighted in the Queen's birthday honours list in June 1988.
sentences.cn: 他于1988年6月被封为爵士，是女王生日宴会上的受勋者之一。

sentences.en: Her Latin is not very good, but it can probably be pulled up between now and next June.
sentences.cn: 她的拉丁语不太好，但从现在到明年六月她可能会有所提高。

sentences.en: I've been here, oh, since the end of June.
sentences.cn: 我是，呃，6月底来到这里的。

sentences.en: In June 1942, the British 8th Army was in full retreat.
June always rhymes with moon in old love songs.
sentences.cn: 在老情歌中June总是和moon成韵。

sentences.en: She was born Jenny Harvey on June 11, 1946.
sentences.cn: 她在1946年6月11号出生，取名叫珍妮·哈维。

sentences.en: The English countryside looks its best in May and June.
sentences.cn: 英国乡村在五、六月间景色最美。

sentences.en: The hillsides in June flame with azaleas.
sentences.cn: 六月的山坡一片杜鹃花红似火焰。

sentences.en: The large, purplish blue flowers appear in early June.
sentences.cn: 略微发紫的大朵蓝花在6月初绽放。

sentences.en: The nation's unemployment rate has been climbing steadily since last June.
sentences.cn: 自去年6月以来，该国的失业率一直在不断上升。

sentences.en: The new machine will go on line in June 2006.
sentences.cn: 新机器将于2006年6月投入使用。

sentences.en: The three month time limit will be up in mid-June.
They have been held in detention since the end of June.
sentences.cn: 他们从6月底以来就一直受到监禁。

sentences.en: They throng the beaches between late June and early August.
sentences.cn: 6月底到8月初，他们群聚在海滩上。

sentences.en: You can take the financial brakes off in June.

trans.tran_en: the sixth month of the year, between May and July
the sixth month of the year, between May and July
